facts.title: Football Wonder
facts.fact: At the 1954 FIFA World Cup, Germany defeated the rising football power Hungary in the final, despite Hungary defeating Germany 8-3 in the group stage.

facts.title: The Longest Race
facts.fact: The longest bicycle race in the world is the Tour de France, typically consisting of 21 stages and covering over 3,500 kilometers.

facts.title: Legendary Basketball Player
facts.fact: Michael Jordan, a six-time NBA champion and iconic basketball player, began his career in college, where his team won the NCAA championship in 1982.

facts.title: Legendary Olympics
facts.fact: The 1896 Athens Olympics were the first modern Olympic Games and included only 13 events.

facts.title: Hockey History
facts.fact: The longest professional hockey game took place in 1936, lasting 176 minutes and 30 seconds, with six overtime periods.

facts.title: Swimming Feats
facts.fact: Swimmer Michael Phelps holds the record for the most Olympic gold medals, with 23 golds in total.

facts.title: Golf's Majors
facts.fact: Professional golf has four major championships: The Masters, the U.S. Open, The Open Championship (British Open), and the PGA Championship.

facts.title: Grand Slam Tennis
facts.fact: In tennis, winning all four major championships (Australian Open, French Open, Wimbledon, and U.S. Open) in a single year is called a Grand Slam.

facts.title: Boxing Legends

facts.title: Olympic Symbols
facts.fact: The five interlocking rings on the Olympic flag represent the continents of Africa, America, Asia, Europe, and Oceania.

facts.title: Marathon Origins
facts.fact: The marathon race is named after the Battle of Marathon, an ancient Greek battle where a runner delivered news of victory.

facts.title: Cricket Records

facts.title: Super Bowl Tradition
